alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 10:56PM EDT until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Essex, Passaic, and Morris Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. At 20.0 feet, Eagle Rock Avenue in Roseland is subject to flooding. Camp Lane Road, River Edge Drive and Broadway Lane in Fairfield are flooded. Stewart Place is closed. At 20.5 feet, Bloomfield Avenue in West Caldwell floods. Matt Drive, Brook Street and Oak Road in Fairfield are flooded and subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM EDT Wednesday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue falling to 18.9 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 01/21/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.9 Wed 10 p 19.7 19.3 Crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 900 AM EDT.
